jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #6505: ARROW-7965: [Python] Hold a reference to the dataset factory for later reuse
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6505#discussion_r385898461
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/_dataset.pyx
 ##########
 @@ -54,12 +54,18 @@ cdef class Dataset:
         shared_ptr[CDataset] wrapped
         CDataset* dataset
 
-    def __init__(self, children, Schema schema not None):
+    cdef readonly:
+        # if a factory object has instantiated the dataset construction then
+        # hold a reference for the factory to reuse it later
+        DatasetFactory factory
 
 Review comment:
   Can you put this in a private attribute? (or is this not visible on the python side because it's a readonly cdef attribute?)

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6505: ARROW-7965: [Python] Hold a reference to the dataset factory for later reuse
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6505#issuecomment-608984476
 
 
   This is blocked by https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6721 (which is blocked by a strange R failure, I think).
   
   I added it to the 0.17 milestone, as it it would be nice to get this in, as I noted in the JIRA:
   
   > This depends on ARROW-8164, but if that gets merged quickly, it would be nice tackle this issue for 0.17 since that would enable us to remove `factory()` from the high-level user API (which wasn't there yet in 0.16, so this would avoid it ever being in a released version)
   
   But it is also certainly not a blocker, since the datasets API is still experimental anyway.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Provide a more intuitive way to construct nested dataset:

```python
# instead of using confusing factory function
dataset([
     factory("s3://old-taxi-data", format="parquet"),
     factory("local/path/to/new/data", format="csv")
])

# let the user to construct a new dataset directly from dataset objects
dataset([ 
    dataset("s3://old-taxi-data", format="parquet"),
    dataset("local/path/to/new/data", format="csv")
])
```

In the future we might want to introduce a new Dataset class which wraps functionality of both the dataset actory and the materialized dataset enabling optimizations over rediscovery of already materialized datasets.

comments.body: This depends on ARROW-8164, but if that gets merged quickly, it would be nice tackle this issue for 0.17 since that would enable us to remove `factory()` from the high-level user API (which wasn't there yet in 0.16, so this would avoid it ever being in a released version)
